summary: This document is a collection of FAA aircraft registration records for a Bell 430 helicopter with tail number N331JE (previously N901RL), owned by Hyperion Air LLC (formerly Hyperion Air Inc.). It includes registration applications, bills of sale, renewal notices, and international flight declarations spanning 2012 to 2019, showing the aircraft's ownership and operational history.

persons.name: Lawrence Visosky
persons.context: Signed as 'Manager' for Hyperion Air LLC on a 2019 aircraft registration application and as 'Director of Aviation' for Hyperion Air Inc. on a 2012 international flight declaration.

persons.name: Angie Risley
persons.context: Requested the reservation of tail number N331JE for Hyperion Air Inc. via Insured Aircraft Title Service, Inc. in May 2012.

persons.name: William P Merriam Jnr
persons.context: Signed as a director for the seller (likely Composer Development Corp) on a 2012 bill of sale transferring the aircraft to Hyperion Air Inc.

connections.description: Lawrence Visosky is listed as the Manager for Hyperion Air LLC on official FAA registration documents.
Lawrence Visosky is listed as the Director of Aviation for Hyperion Air Inc. on a 2012 international flight declaration.
Angie Risley acted on behalf of Hyperion Air Inc. to request a tail number reservation through a title service.

events.title: Reservation of Tail Number N331JE
events.description: Insured Aircraft Title Service, Inc., on behalf of Hyperion Air Inc., requested the reservation of special registration number N331JE for aircraft N901RL.

events.title: Assignment of Special Registration Number
events.description: FAA authorized the change of the aircraft's registration number from N901RL to the special number N331JE.

events.title: International Ferry Flight
events.description: Hyperion Air Inc. declared an international ferry flight for N331JE from West Palm Beach, Florida, to St. Thomas, USVI, with stops in the Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, and the Dominican Republic.

events.title: Aircraft Sale to Hyperion Air LLC
events.description: Hyperion Air, Inc. sold the Bell 430 helicopter (N331JE) to Hyperion Air LLC via a bill of sale.

events.title: Aircraft Registration Expired
events.description: The FAA notified Hyperion Air LLC that the registration for N331JE had expired and the N-number was pending cancellation.

events.title: Registration Application Filed
events.description: Lawrence Visosky, as Manager of Hyperion Air LLC, signed an Aircraft Registration Application in an attempt to renew or address the expired registration for N331JE.

locations: Oklahoma City, Oklahoma (FAA Aircraft Registry location)
keyFacts: The Bell 430 helicopter with serial number 49078 was registered under tail numbers N901RL and later the special number N331JE.
The aircraft was owned by Hyperion Air Inc. and later sold to the related entity Hyperion Air LLC in August 2013.
The aircraft was used for an international ferry flight in July 2012 from Florida to the US Virgin Islands via multiple Caribbean stops.
The aircraft's registration expired on September 30, 2019, and was pending cancellation as of November 2019.
Lawrence Visosky served as a key manager/director for both Hyperion Air entities in dealings with the FAA.
